page.title: 09Boston Grammar School
page.content: In 1825 it had 50-60 pupils but by 1847 it had none at all.Then by 1864 the number of pupils was up to90, including 20 boarders: in 1927 the fourth centanary it had over 380 pupils. Now next to the Hussey Tower there is some tennis courts.Now they are building a chemistry room.The ages of the pupils are about 11-18. Mr.Shrimpton is the headmaster.It was once the home of Lord Hussey who was Lord Luitenant of the county and was beheaded at Lincoln in 1537.The beast mart is still proclaimed though there are no beasts for sale, in December every year.
